topics.body:
Well Family Drama, is not over in my family in forever.

Basically my Aunt married a scumbag. She broke up with him. And ever since he's been making her life a living hell. 

Now he wants her house. Which is bad. Heck what a criminal want with a house anyways. I tend to stay away from Family Drama. And don't *EVER* talk about it to keep my sanity.

topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551781fa63687230b6620d00#post_551781fa63687230b6620d00
I was going with a magic-based world with mostly fantasy but has a bit of sci-fi here and there.
It was about a red-haired man and his group of Explorers travelling the world.

The story would be a bit like One Piece and Naruto but the crucial part of the story would be about the protagonist.

I wrote the story so that the reader knows very little about the protagonist, with him making up lies of his past and showing skills that nobody knew he could do. _He's not what he seems._

topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551785d4636872361ede0000#post_551785d4636872361ede0000
Yep, that's the plan.
But with more unique settings.

Imagine it like a proceduraly generated worlds like in Terraria or Starbound, but in a manga with each arc within those different world. Of course, in the case of the idea I had, it would be kingdoms or countries.

I already thought of vampire country, candy kingdom (heh), capitol-style like in Hunger Games (but more joyful), a normal Authurian kingdom, pirates, floating isles, underwater cities, orbital cannon vs tall tower, magic academy, steampunk metropolis, etc.

There's a bunch more but it's hard to type them all.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976
